                    Name ="cbFindName"
                    RowSourceType ="Table/Query"
                    RowSource ="SELECT Judges.JUN, Persons.LNAME & \", \" & [FNAME] & \" \" & [MI] & \" \" & [SA"
                        "LUTATION] & \" (\" & [TP] & \")\" AS JName FROM Persons RIGHT JOIN Judges ON Per"
                        "sons.PID=Judges.PID ORDER BY Persons.LNAME & \", \" & [FNAME] & \" \" & [MI] & \""
                        " \" & [SALUTATION] & \" (\" & [TP] & \")\"; "
                    ColumnWidths ="0;2592"
                    AfterUpdate ="[Event Procedure]"
                    OnEnter ="[Event Procedure]"
                    BaseInfo ="\"SELECT Judges.JUN, Persons.LNAME & \"\", \"\" & [FNAME] & \"\" \"\" & [MI] & \""

                        "HT JOIN Judges ON Persons.PID=Judges.PID ORDER BY Persons.LNAME & \"\", \"\" & ["
                        "FNAME] & \"\" \"\" & [MI] & \"\" \"\" & [SALUTATION] & \"\" (\"\" & [TP] & \"\")"

                    OnExit ="[Event Procedure]"
                    OnNotInList ="[Event Procedure]"
                    BaseInfo ="\"SELECT Persons.PID, [LNAME] & \"\", \"\" & [FNAME] & \"\" \"\" & [MI] & \"\" \""
                        "\" & [salutation] & \"\"  (\"\" & [TP] & \"\")\"\" AS PName FROM Persons ORDER B"
                        "Y [LNAME] & \"\", \"\" & [FNAME] & \"\" \"\" & [MI] & \"\" \"\" & [salutation] &"
                        " \"\"  (\"\" & [TP] & \"\")\"\"; \";\"Persons\";\"\";\"PID\";\"[LNAME] & \"\", \""
                        "\" & [FNAME] & \"\" \"\" & [MI] & \"\" \"\" & [salutation] & \"\"  \";\"PrimaryK"
                        "ey\""

                    Top =4800
                    Width =1020
                    TabIndex =22
                    ColumnInfo ="\"\";\"\";\"\";\"\";\"10\";\"12\""
                    GUID = Begin
                        0x3fe8a9ec5273d811a62400065b52e8b4
                    End
                    Name ="cbP_1"
                    ControlSource ="P_1"
                    RowSourceType ="Table/Query"
                    RowSource ="SELECT JudgeTypes.JCAT, JudgeTypes.[JCAT NAME] FROM JudgeTypes; "
                    ColumnWidths ="645;2880"
                    OnExit ="[Event Procedure]"

                    Begin
                        Begin Label
                            OverlapFlags =85

                            End

                    End

                    LimitToList = NotDefault

                        0x4de8a9ec5273d811a62400065b52e8b4

                        "dges ON Persons.PID=Judges.PID ORDER BY Judges.JUN; "
                    ColumnWidths ="504;2592"

End
CodeBehindForm
Attribute VB_GlobalNameSpace = False
Attribute VB_Creatable = True
Attribute VB_PredeclaredId = True
Attribute VB_Exposed = False
'    SciFairMaster.mdb  (All class objects and modules)
'
'    Copyright (C) 2001,2002,2003,2004,2005,2006,2007,2008,2009,2010,2011,2012,2013,
'                  2014  Dennis e.Spanogle
'
'    This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
'    it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
'    the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
'    (at your option) any later version.
'
'    This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
'    but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
'    MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
'    GNU General Public License for more details.
'
'    You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
'    along with this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
Option Compare Database
Option Explicit
Private HoldCRCState As Boolean ' current state of 'Confirm Record Change' option
Private personsRS As Recordset
Private dbSciFair As Database
Private criteria As String
Private msg As String
Private Title As String
Private DidDelete As Boolean
Private DeletePID As Long
Private deleteJUN As Long
Private DidAdd As Boolean
Private DidPersonAdd As Boolean
Dim NewPID As Long
Private ctlPrevFocus As Control
Private DirtyCount As Integer
Private tJUN As Long
Private tLNAME As String
Private tFNAME As String


Private Sub cbFindName_AfterUpdate()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If IsNull(Me.cbFindName) Then Exit Sub
   ' Find the record that matches the control.
   Me.Recordset.FindFirst "[JUN] = " & Str(Me![cbFindName])
   'Dim rs As Object
   'Set rs = Me.Recordset.Clone
   'rs.FindFirst "[JUN] = " & str(Me![cbFindName])
   'Me.Bookmark = rs.Bookmark
   cbFindName = Null
   Me.STATUS.SetFocus
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbFindName_Enter()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If DidDelete = True Then
     Me.cbFindName.Requery
     Me.cbJUN.Requery
     DidDelete = False
   End If
   If DidAdd = True Then
     Me.cbFindName.Requery
     Me.cbJUN.Requery
     DidAdd = False
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbJUN_AfterUpdate()
    Dim rs As Object
    Dim xval As Integer
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If (IsNull(Me.cbJUN)) Then
       MsgBox "No JUN Selected"
       cbJUN.SetFocus
       Exit Sub
    End If
    xval = Me![cbJUN]
    Me.Recordset.FindFirst "[JUN] = " & Format(xval) & " "
    'Set rs = Me.Recordset.Clone
    'rs.FindFirst "[JUN] = " & Format(xval) & " "
    'Me.Bookmark = rs.Bookmark
    Me.cbJUN = Null
    Me.STATUS.SetFocus
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub

Private Sub cbJUN_Enter()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If DidDelete = True Then
     Me.cbJUN.Requery
     Me.cbFindName.Requery
     DidDelete = False
   End If
   If DidAdd = True Then
     Me.cbJUN.Requery
     Me.cbFindName.Requery
     DidAdd = False
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbPerson_BeforeUpdate(Cancel As Integer)
   ' this routine not called if notinlist response is acDataErrContinue
   ' I.E. if added a new name with ; or if fixname (changed string)
   ' User selected existing Person for a New record (only way to get here)
   ' The person selected could already be a Judge etc.  This would not be
   ' a good thing so I will not allow it.
   On Error GoTo SubError
   ' Find the record that matches the new PID
   Dim rs As Object
   Set rs = Me.Recordset.Clone
   rs.FindFirst "[PID] = " & cbPerson.Value 'contains the PID of seleced person
   If rs.NoMatch Then
      ' Find just continue
   Else
      MsgBox "Already a Judge!" & vbCrLf & _
             "Select a different Person", vbOKOnly, Title
      Cancel = True
      Exit Sub
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbPerson_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
   '  Do this code for new adds  - need a JUN and other defaults set
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Dim JuNum As Integer
   Dim ii As Integer
   Dim maxJun As Integer
   If cbLimitJun.Value = -1 Then ' NOTE Default is -1 (Limit) new 02/11/05
      maxJun = 1999
   Else
      maxJun = 9999  ' search for any 4 digit judge number new 02/11/05
   End If
   If IsNull(Me.JUN) Or Me.JUN = 0 Then '-----------  '  FIND An UNUSED JUN --
     txtSearchJUN.Visible = True
     DoEvents
     Me.cbJUN.Requery   ' Make sure the JUN list is uptodate
     For JuNum = 101 To maxJun
       For ii = 0 To Me.cbJUN.ListCount - 1  ' check all number in query
         If Val(Me.cbJUN.Column(0, ii)) = JuNum Then
           Exit For ' JUN used, so do nothing
         End If
       Next ii
       If ii = Me.cbJUN.ListCount Then 'this is true if did not find JUN
         ' did not find, can use this JUN
         Me.JUN = JuNum ' ----- Fill in the JUN field --------------------
         Exit For
       End If
     Next JuNum
     txtSearchJUN.Visible = False
     DoEvents
     If JuNum >= maxJun Then  ' This may occur
       msg = "No available Judge Numbers < " & maxJun + 1 & vbCrLf & _
             "If no JUN < 2000 then you must delete Judges who are" & vbCrLf & _
             "Inactive and who have not judged in many years."
       MsgBox msg, vbOKOnly, Title
     End If
     Me.FIRST_YR = FairYear()
     Me.LAST_YR = FairYear()
     Me.NUM_YR = 0
     Me.Temp = "SL" 'New Judge Needs a Letter and Survey  Send Letter
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Timer()
  ' This moves to the next object in the case a persons was added to cbPerson
  ' that was not orgionally typed or in case the orgional string had a ';'
  ' SEE cbPerson_NotInList
    ' Discovered why vbESC, Chr(27) etc do not work. Since they are
  ' non printing characters, they must be enclosed in brackets
  ' i.e.  SendKeys {vbKeyEscape}  etc.  Note addere rev 1.0.8
  
  On Error GoTo SubError
  DidPersonAdd = False
  Me.TimerInterval = 0
  SendKeys "{TAB}"  '(vbCrLf)not good puts in next field - use tab
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbPerson_NotInList(newdata As String, Response As Integer)
   ' If the person is not in the Persons Table then we need to add a record
   ' To the persons table.
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If Person_NotInList(Me, "Judges", "RJ", newdata, Response, _
            DidPersonAdd, False) = True Then ' last parm=false -> no duplicates
     If Response = acDataErrAdded Then ' Person added just as typed
         ' Focus will move to next object, no more work
     Else  ' Added diferent person (List selection) or had ';' in string
         ' Focus remains with cbPerson with new person selected.
         ' try to move on to next object with timer...
         ' Note in this case cbperson_BeforeAfter update not called
         Me.TimerInterval = 50  ' wait 50 milliseconds.  Should be
         ' enough for slower PCs (133 Mhz) since 1 Ms works for 833Mhz PC
     End If
   Else   ' failed to work or user canceled add..
     ' Origionally typed string still in combo box, user can edit or whatever!
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_BeforeUpdate(Cancel As Integer)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Dim tpstr As String
  If ckboxNoJCATMsg.Value = True Then
   If (IsNull(Me.JCAT) Or Len(Me.JCAT) < 1) Then
    If MsgBox("UpDate: JCAT is Blank!" & vbCrLf & _
             "Assign to First Preference [P_1]?", vbYesNo) = vbYes Then
      Me.JCAT = Me.P_1
    End If
   End If
  End If
  tpstr = IIf(IsNull(Me.TP), "", Me.TP)
  Call setFieldTP(tpstr, "RJ")
  Me.TP = tpstr
  Me.LAST_CHG = Format(Now, "mm/dd/yy")
  Me.J_LAST_CHG = Format(Now, "mm/dd/yy")
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_AfterUpdate()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Me.cbFindName.Requery
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Current()
   ' Important.  If a Delete is done while in a new record (or anytime actually)
   '   Form_Current is called.  This can cause wierd situations in the case the
   '   user does a delet while adding a new record. Me.NewRecord is set to
   '   false as soon as any data is entered in the form but so I can not
   '   always rely on that parameter to tell.  Anyway.   If a Delete is done
   '   while in a new record (even if me.NewRecord is False) Form_Current
   '   is called.  This causes big problems if I set any fields in Form_Current
   '   because then Me.NewRecord is set false and Access sees the data as
   '   a record and it must be completed before can move records etc.
   '  BOTTOM LINE.   DO NOT SET fields in Form_Current
   '                 DO NOt use code in Form_Current that will prevent a
   '                 Call to Form_AfterDeleteConfirm (I think setting fields)
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Me.Label_SandiaMS.Visible = False ' Used by Form_Dirty if is sandia person
   DirtyCount = 0
   If Me.NewRecord Then       '   -------------  NEW RECORD -----------------
     DidAdd = True ' Just used to Requery cbFindName
     Me.tbRecord = 1 + Me.Recordset.RecordCount
     Me.tbNumRec = 1 + Me.Recordset.RecordCount
     Me.cbPerson.Locked = False  ' Allow input of name
     Me.JUN.Locked = False       ' Allow input of JUN
    ' Dim junum As Integer
    ' Dim ii As Integer
    ' Me.cbJUN.Requery   ' Make sure the JUN list is uptodate
    ' For junum = 101 To 999
    '   For ii = 0 To Me.cbJUN.ListCount - 1  ' check all number in query
    '     If val(Me.cbJUN.Column(0, ii)) = junum Then
    '       Exit For ' JUN used, so do nothing
    '     End If
    '   Next ii
    '   If ii = Me.cbJUN.ListCount Then 'this is true if did not find JUN
    '     ' did not find, can use this JUN
    '     Me.JUN = junum ' ----- Fill in the JUN field --------------------
    '     Exit For
    '   End If
    ' Next junum
    ' If junum = 1000 Then  ' This may occur
    '   msg = "No available Judge Numbers < 1000" & vbCrLf & _
    '        "Enter JUN manually"
    '   MsgBox msg, vbOKOnly, Title
    ' End If
    ' Me.FIRST_YR = FairYear()
    ' Me.LAST_YR = FairYear()
    ' Me.NUM_YR = 0
    ' Me.Temp = "SL" 'New Judge Needs a Letter and Survey  Send Letter
   Else  '-----------EXISTING RECORD -----------------
     Me.cbPerson.Locked = True
     'Me.JUN.Locked = True       ' No Changes to JUN
     Me.tbNumRec = Me.Recordset.RecordCount
     Me.tbRecord = Me.CurrentRecord
   End If   '                        -------   Current or New Record --------
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Delete(Cancel As Integer)
   ' This plus Sub Form_BeforeDelConfirm work to ALWAYS show a delete message
   ' Even if user has turned off the warning messages.
   On Error GoTo SubError
   msg = "DELETE RECORD?"
   If MsgBox(msg, vbYesNo + vbDefaultButton2, Title) = vbNo Then
      Cancel = True
      Exit Sub
   End If
   DidDelete = True   ' Indicate did a delete of the judge
   ' Can Not Delete the person yet because the judge Record Still Exists.
   ' This is due to Enforce Referential Integrity being set.
   ' So save the PID (person_ of the judge being deleted  so can ask later
   ' IMPORTANT:   IF we were in a new record (Even though me.NewRecord = False)
   ' Access now SETS NewRecord True and Form.Current is CALLED. This happens
   ' Before the Form_AfterDelete Confirm.  In Fact in some cases My Code in
   ' Form_Current can cause AfterDelConfirm to NOT BE CALLED.  This is true
   ' If the code in Form_Current sets any fields true (which then sets any
   ' autonumbers (like TID, STID...depending on which form and query)
   ' BEST to NOT SET FIELDS IN Form_Current
   DeletePID = Me.PID
   tJUN = Me.JUN
   tLNAME = IIf(IsNull(Me.LNAME), "", Me.LNAME)
   tFNAME = IIf(IsNull(Me.FNAME), "", Me.FNAME)
   Exit Sub  ' Judge record will be deleted on exit
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_BeforeDelConfirm(Cancel As Integer, Response As Integer)
   ' This suppresses the system confirmation message, I give message in
   ' Sub Form_Delete (
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Response = acDataErrContinue
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_AfterDelConfirm(STATUS As Integer)
  ' Use this to delete other related records (i.e. Persons) BUT,
  ' You must do :me.Application.SetOption "Confirm RecordChanges",True
  '   Or this Routine is NEVER CALLED!
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Call ScifairLog("Del Judge JUN: ", tJUN, " " & tLNAME & ", " & tFNAME)
   If DeletePID > 0 Then
     Call DeleteFixPerson(DeletePID, "RJ")
   End If
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Load()
  ' The next statements give a type mismatch error unless or until
  ' I fixed the priority of references in the Visual Basic Tools option.
  ' Sequence must be:
  ' Visual Basic for Applications
  ' Microsoft Access 9.0 Library
  ' Microsoft Office 9.0 Library
  ' OLE Automation
  ' Microsoft DAO 3.6 Obj Lib
  ' Microsoft Visual Basic of Application Extensibility 5.3
  '  Others as needed
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Title = "Judges Edit"
  ' This is Required If any Work is done in me.AfterDeleteConfirm_Click Action
  HoldCRCState = Me.Application.GetOption("Confirm Record Changes")
  Me.Application.SetOption "Confirm Record Changes", True
  DidDelete = False
  DeletePID = 0
  DidAdd = False
  Me.Rev.Caption = RevisionDate
  ckboxNoJCATMsg.Value = True
  DirtyCount = 0
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Close()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Me.Application.SetOption "Confirm Record Changes", HoldCRCState
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub JUN_BeforeUpdate(Cancel As Integer)
   On Error GoTo SubError
   
    If Me.[JUN] > 1999 And (Me.[STATUS] = "A" Or Me.[STATUS] = "L") Then
       MsgBox "ACTIVE Judges can not have Judge Number > 1999" & vbCrLf & _
              "Press [OK] then Press [Esc] key to cancel change"
      'Me.[JUN].Value = Me.[JUN].OldValue
       Cancel = True
       Exit Sub
   End If
   msg = "You are about to change the Key Value JUN!" & vbCrLf & _
          "Although OK, Be sure you want to do this!" & vbCrLf & _
          "Tables with references to this Judge will be updated if" & vbCrLf & _
          "Referential Integrity & Cascade Update are both set." & vbCrLf & _
          "(Hint: If you select [No], Press [Esc] key to cancel change) " & vbCrLf & _
          "CHANGE JUN? "
   If MsgBox(msg, vbYesNo + vbDefaultButton2, Title) = vbNo Then
     'Me.[JUN].Value = Me.[JUN].OldValue
     Cancel = True
     Exit Sub
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub CheckIfAssigned(jnum As Long)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Dim exJudgesRS As Recordset
  Set exJudgesRS = CurrentDb().OpenRecordset("Select * from ExhibitJudges", _
       dbOpenDynaset)
  With exJudgesRS
     .FindFirst "JUN = " & jnum
     If Not .NoMatch Then
        MsgBox "THIS JUDGE has been assigned (in ExhibitJudges)" & vbCrLf & _
               "IF YOU HAVE PREPRINTED CARDS it is Best to" & vbCrLf & _
               "SET STATUS BACK ACTIVE NOW else you must:" & vbCrLf & _
               " * Give Cards to Another Judge ... or ..." & vbCrLf & _
               " * Reassign Judges AND  PrePrint CARDS again" & vbCrLf & _
               "   (Now that would not be fun would it - Duh?)"
     End If
  End With
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub

Private Sub STATUS_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
' NOTE: Setting to upper case is mostly for visual consistency. It is not
'       required for finding and matching as is was in dBase!
    On Error GoTo SubError
    
    If IsNull(Me.[STATUS]) Then
       If Me.STATUS.OldValue = "A" Then
         Call ScifairLog("Chg Judge STATUS 'A' to Blank - JUN: ", Me.JUN, Me.LNAME & ", " & Me.FNAME)
         Call CheckIfAssigned(Me.JUN)
       End If
       Exit Sub ' no need to check
    End If
    If Asc(Me.[STATUS]) <> Asc(UCase(Me.[STATUS])) Then ' do only not ucase
        Me.[STATUS] = UCase(Me.[STATUS])
    End If
    If Me.[STATUS] = "A" Or Me.[STATUS] = "L" Then
      If Me.[JUN] > 2000 Then
        MsgBox "Active Judges must have Judge Number < 2000" & vbCrLf & _
               "STATUS NOT CHANGED!"
        Me.[STATUS] = Me.STATUS.OldValue
        Cancel = 1
        Exit Sub
      End If
    End If
    If Me.STATUS.OldValue = "A" And Me.STATUS <> "A" Then
      Call ScifairLog("Chg Judge STATUS 'A' to " & Me.STATUS & _
                   " - JUN: ", Me.JUN, Me.LNAME & ", " & Me.FNAME)
      Call CheckIfAssigned(Me.JUN)
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub LOCAL_FAIR_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If IsNull(Me.[LOCAL_FAIR]) Then Exit Sub ' no need to check
    If Asc(Me.[LOCAL_FAIR]) <> Asc(UCase(Me.[LOCAL_FAIR])) Then ' do only not ucase
        Me.[LOCAL_FAIR] = UCase(Me.[LOCAL_FAIR])
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub TEAM_OK_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If IsNull(Me.[TEAM_OK]) Then Exit Sub ' no need to check
    If Asc(Me.[TEAM_OK]) <> Asc(UCase(Me.[TEAM_OK])) Then ' do only not ucase
        Me.[TEAM_OK] = UCase(Me.[TEAM_OK])
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub TP_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
   On Error GoTo SubError
  Dim tpstr As String
  tpstr = IIf(IsNull(Me.TP), "", Me.TP)
  Call setFieldTP(tpstr, "TH")
  Me.TP = tpstr
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub STATE_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If IsNull(Me.[STATE]) Then Exit Sub ' no need to check
    If StrComp(Me.[STATE], UCase(Me.[STATE]), 0) <> 0 Then ' Binary compare
        Me.[STATE] = UCase(Me.[STATE])   ' do only if not already ucase
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub MAILPREF_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If IsNull(Me.[MAILPREF]) Then Exit Sub ' no need to check
    If Asc(Me.[MAILPREF]) <> Asc(UCase(Me.[MAILPREF])) Then ' do only not ucase
        Me.[MAILPREF] = UCase(Me.[MAILPREF])
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub DEGREE_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If IsNull(Me.[DEGREE]) Then Exit Sub ' no need to check
    If StrComp(Me.[DEGREE], UCase(Me.[DEGREE]), 0) <> 0 Then ' Binary compare
        Me.[DEGREE] = UCase(Me.[DEGREE])   ' do only if not already ucase
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub EXPER_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If IsNull(Me.[EXPER]) Then Exit Sub ' no need to check
    If StrComp(Me.[EXPER], UCase(Me.[EXPER]), 0) <> 0 Then ' Binary compare
        Me.[EXPER] = UCase(Me.[EXPER])   ' do only if not already ucase
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbP_1_Exit(Cancel As Integer) ' Set JCAT = P_1 if JCAT Blank
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If (IsNull(Me.JCAT) Or Len(Me.JCAT) < 1) Then
      Me.JCAT = Me.P_1
      Me.Refresh
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Function IsSandia() As Boolean
      On Error GoTo SubError
      Dim s1 As Integer
      Dim s2 As Integer
      Dim s3 As Integer
      Dim s4 As Integer
      s1 = 0: s2 = 0: s3 = 0: s4 = 0
      If Not IsNull(Me.ADDR1) Then
        s1 = InStr(1, Me.[ADDR1], "5800")
        s2 = InStr(1, Me.[ADDR1], "Sandia")
      End If
      If Not IsNull(Me.ADDR2) Then
        s3 = InStr(1, Me.[ADDR2], "5800")
        s4 = InStr(1, Me.[ADDR2], "Sandia")
      End If
      If (s1 > 0 Or s3 > 0) And (s2 > 0 Or s4 > 0) Then
         Me.Label_SandiaMS.Visible = True
         IsSandia = True
      End If
      Exit Function
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Function
Private Sub ZIP_Enter()
    On Error GoTo SubError
    Dim test1 As Boolean
    test1 = IsSandia
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Dirty(Cancel As Integer)
  ' Goes here if ANY change is done to the record
  ' Do not know why but calls this 500 or more times on the
  ' First occasion of dirty.  ???  This is why the DirtyCount is used.
  ' Set DirtyCount = 0 on Form_Current Event
  ' Pressing [Esc] Twice will reset all fields including these below
    On Error GoTo SubError
    Dim test1 As Boolean
    If DirtyCount = 0 Then ' Do this only once, first edit after current
      test1 = IsSandia
      DirtyCount = 1  ' must do before next as they cause a new
                      ' call to dirty
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub MAJOR_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If IsNull(Me.[MAJOR]) Then Exit Sub ' no need to check
    If StrComp(Me.[MAJOR], UCase(Me.[MAJOR]), 0) <> 0 Then ' Binary compare
        Me.[MAJOR] = UCase(Me.[MAJOR])   ' do only if not already ucase
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub MINOR_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If IsNull(Me.[MINOR]) Then Exit Sub ' no need to check
    If StrComp(Me.[MINOR], UCase(Me.[MINOR]), 0) <> 0 Then ' Binary compare
        Me.[MINOR] = UCase(Me.[MINOR])   ' do only if not already ucase
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnFirst_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnFirst_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnFirst_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acFirst
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnFirst_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnFirst_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnFirst_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnPrev_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnPrev_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnPrev_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acPrevious
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnPrev_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnPrev_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnPrev_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnNext_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnNext_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnNext_Click
    If Me.CurrentRecord = Me.Recordset.RecordCount Then
       MsgBox "End of Data!"
       ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
       Exit Sub
    End If
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acNext
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnNext_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnNext_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnNext_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnLast_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnLast_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnLast_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acLast
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnLast_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnLast_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnLast_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnAdd_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnAdd_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acNewRec
    Me.cbPerson.SetFocus
Exit_btnAdd_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnAdd_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnAdd_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnDelete_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnDelete_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnDelete_Click
      DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, 8, , acMenuVer70
      DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, 6, , acMenuVer70
      ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnDelete_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnDelete_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnDelete_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnSave_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnSave_Click()
    Dim svJUN As Long
    On Error GoTo Err_btnSave_Click
    DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acRecordsMenu, acSaveRecord, , acMenuVer70
    svJUN = Me.JUN
    ' The next command does a Remove Filter Sort which in effect requeries
    DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acRecordsMenu, 3, , acMenuVer70 'RemFiltSort
    Me.Recordset.FindFirst "JUN = " & svJUN
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnSave_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnSave_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnSave_Click
End Sub
